p: However, a newly described post-infectious complication of SARS-CoV-2, known as multisystem inflammatory syndrome in children (MIS-C), is being reported. This is a Kawasaki-like syndrome that presents as fever, prominent gastrointestinal upset, rash, conjunctivitis, and neurological findings. In comparison to conventional Kawasaki’s, children with MIS-C are less likely to have coronary involvement [ 22]. Although causality between SARS-CoV-2 and MIS-C has not been proven, reports of an increased incidence of Kawasaki-like syndrome in areas heavily affected by the pandemic show an epidemiological link [ 23].
